at.fhv.dgr1992.ePuck.ePuckVRep

Class EPuckVRep

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.fhv.dgr1992.differentialWheels.DifferentialWheels
      • at.fhv.dgr1992.ePuck.EPuck
        • at.fhv.dgr1992.ePuck.ePuckVRep.EPuckVRep

  • public class EPuckVRep
extends EPuck
    The class "EPuckVRep" encapsulates the ePuck robot in a scene of the VRep simulator for a controller: it represents a proxy of the ePuck for the controller.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • EPuckVRep

        public EPuckVRep(java.lang.String robotName,
                 java.lang.String ipAddress,
                 int port)
        Creates a new instance of the EPuckVRep in asynchronous mode and with a max velocity of maxVel = (120 * Math.PI / 180).
        Parameters:
        robotName - Name of the robot inside VRep.
        ipAddress - IP- address of the computer where VRep is running.
        port - Port the robot is mapped to.

      • EPuckVRep

        public EPuckVRep(java.lang.String robotName,
                 java.lang.String ipAddress,
                 int port,
                 boolean synchronous)
        Creates a new instance of the EPuckVRep with a max velocity of maxVel = (120 * Math.PI / 180).
        Parameters:
        robotName - Name of the robot inside VRep.
        ipAddress - IP- address of the computer where VRep is running.
        port - Port the robot is mapped to.
        synchronous - Set to true to control the simulator in single steps.

      • EPuckVRep

        public EPuckVRep(java.lang.String robotName,
                 java.lang.String ipAddress,
                 int port,
                 double maxVelocity,
                 boolean synchronous)
        Creates a new instance of the EPuckVRep.
        Parameters:
        robotName - Name of the robot inside VRep.
        ipAddress - IP- address of the computer where VRep is running.
        port - Port the robot is mapped to.
        maxVelocity - Maximum velocity that the ePuck can drive.
        synchronous - Set to true to control the simulator in single steps.

      • startsim

        public void startsim()
              throws SynchrounusModeNotActivatedException,
                     RobotFunctionCallException,
                     StepSimNotPossibleException
        To be called from a controller when we initialized with synchronous=True. Starts the simulation in synchronous mode to achieve exact simulation independent of the frame rate. One step is performed.
        Throws:
        SynchrounusModeNotActivatedException
        RobotFunctionCallException
        StepSimNotPossibleException

      • stepsim

        public void stepsim(int steps)
             throws SynchrounusModeNotActivatedException,
                    StepSimNotPossibleException,
                    RobotFunctionCallException
        Perform the specified number of steps in the simulator. Requires the instance to be initialized in synchronous mode.
        Parameters:
        steps - number of steps to simulate
        Throws:
        SynchrounusModeNotActivatedException
        StepSimNotPossibleException
        RobotFunctionCallException

        Parameters:
